description: Slow cook pork cutlets in a sweet, tangy sauce for a mouth-watering one-pot meal. Serve over rice and with a side of greens.
name: Chinese Slow-Cooked Pork Cutlets Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 150°C. Finely grate rind of 1 mandarin, then juice. Peel and segment remaining mandarins and set aside.
Combine mandarin juice, rind, stock, soy, sugar, garlic, ginger and white pepper in a jug.

Lightly coat cutlets with flour. Heat oil in a large shallow flameproof casserole over medium heat. Add cutlets and cook for 3 minutes each side or until golden brown. Pour juice mixture over cutlets and bring to the boil. Cover. Cook in oven for 1 1/2 hours or until cutlets are tender (or cook in a pressure cooker for 15 minutes – refer to manufacturer’s guidelines). Top with mandarin segments and onion.
